{{Wikisource|Iraq Liberation Act}}
{{Wikisource|Iraq Liberation Act}}
â
[[Image:Saddam Hussein on his throne.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Saddam Hussein with the [[Flag of Iraq#1991â2004|flag of Iraq]] he implemented during the [[Gulf War]]]]
 
The '''Iraq Liberation Act of 1998''' is a [[United States]] [[United States Congress|Congressional]] statement of policy calling for regime change in Iraq.<ref>[http://frwebgate.access.gpo.gov/cgi-bin/getdoc.cgi?dbname=105_cong_public_laws&docid=f:publ338.105.pdf Public Law 105-338]</ref><ref>It was codified in a note to 22 USCS Â§ 2151.</ref> It was signed into law by President [[Bill Clinton]], and states that it is the policy of the United States to support democratic movements within Iraq. The Act was cited in October 2002 to argue for the [[Authorization for use of Military Force Against Iraq|authorization of military force against the Iraqi government]].
The '''Iraq Liberation Act of 1998''' is a [[United States]] [[United States Congress|Congressional]] statement of policy calling for regime change in Iraq.<ref>[http://frwebgate.access.gpo.gov/cgi-bin/getdoc.cgi?dbname=105_cong_public_laws&docid=f:publ338.105.pdf Public Law 105-338]</ref><ref>It was codified in a note to 22 USCS Â§ 2151.</ref> It was signed into law by President [[Bill Clinton]], and states that it is the policy of the United States to support democratic movements within Iraq. The Act was cited in October 2002 to argue for the [[Authorization for use of Military Force Against Iraq|authorization of military force against the Iraqi government]].
